items.title: As Political Violence Rises, Justice Kavanaugh’s Would-Be Assassin to Be Sentenced
items.summary: Prosecutors have asked a judge for at least 30 years in prison for Sophie Roske, who traveled from California to Maryland intending to kill Justice Brett Kavanaugh.

items.title: Duke Was Paring Back Diversity Programs. Trump Targeted It Anyway.
items.summary: Duke University kept a low profile. But it is the alma mater of Stephen Miller, a top Trump official who often criticized the school while he was a student.

items.title: 23-Year-Old Climber Dies in Fall from Yosemite’s El Capitan
items.summary: The death of Balin Miller, 23, shocked his family and onlookers who were watching his ascent of the famed rock face.

items.title: Large Fire Burns at Chevron Refinery in El Segundo After Explosion
items.summary: It was not immediately clear what caused the blast, which residents said felt like an earthquake. The fire was still burning more than two hours after it started.

items.title: Apple Takes Down ICE Tracking Apps Amid Trump Pressure Campaign
items.summary: Trump administration officials have issued several legal threats over ICEBlock, a popular app that allows users to alert others to the presence of nearby immigration agents.

items.title: Fire still burning at California Chevron refinery following explosion
items.summary: <p>No injuries reported in El Segundo, site of company’s second-biggest US refinery, which supplies jet fuel for LA airport</p><p>A fire that broke out at <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/chevron">Chevron’s</a> El Segundo refinery that supplies jet fuel for Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) was still burning on Friday morning after an explosion at the plant.</p><p>The press office of Gavin Newsom, the California governor, had confirmed that the fire erupted on Thursday night on the outskirts of the city, with a county official adding that the flames had been confined to one area.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/03/large-fire-breaks-out-at-el-segundo-refinery-in-los-angeles">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs to be sentenced after conviction on federal prostitution-related charges – live updates
items.summary: <p>Music mogul could face lengthy prison sentence after being convicted of some charges in July; court proceedings to begin at 10am eastern time</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/music/2025/oct/03/sean-diddy-combs-sentencing">Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs sentencing: what to know</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>A former girlfriend, R&amp;B singer Casandra “Cassie” Ventura, testified during the trial that Combs ordered her to have “disgusting” sex with strangers hundreds of times during their decade-long relationship.</strong></p><p>The jury was repeatedly shown video clips of Combs dragging and beating Cassie in a Los Angeles hotel hallway after one of those multiday sexual marathons, which she referred to as “freak-offs” during her four days of testimony.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/03/sean-diddy-combs-sentencing-trial-conviction-latest-updates">Continue reading...</a>
